title: Blood Of Pride
opening: At long last, Lyn arrives in the land of her mother's birth. Lycia is a federation of territories, each one ruled by a powerful marquess. Now, Lyn takes her leave of one of these territories, Araphen and sets out to meet her grandfather, the marquess of Caelin. However, the marquess's brother, Lundgren, hungers to rule over Caelin. He is preparing a deadly welcome for Lyn, who stands to threaten his grasp for power.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What city is this?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: This? This is Araphen. After Ostia, it’s the second-biggest city in Lycia.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: The second biggest, hm? It does seem awfully busy. By the way, where’s Kent?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: He said he was going ahead to the castle, but... Ah, here he comes now.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Milady Lyndis! Let us proceed to the castle. They’ve prepared supplies for us. The marquess has agreed to aid us on our journey to Caelin.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: He’s going to help us?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Yes. Araphen and Caelin have enjoyed a sturdy friendship for many years. Once I informed the marquess our plight, he agreed to lend us his strength.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Looks like we’ve got a smooth road ahead!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: If we could pick up some soldiers, the road to Caelin would be that much safer. I’m truly sorry for hardships you’ve suffered so far.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Don’t be silly. You are so capable, Kent.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Kent!?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hm? Oh, and so are you, Sain.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Of course I am!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: The castle awaits...

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: This is terrible! The castle is burning!!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: What did you say? What’s happening?

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: Smoke! From the castle! Hey! What are those men doing?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Who are you?

intro.speaker: Assassin
intro.line: You! You’re Lyndis, aren’t you?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Ah! What do you–

intro.speaker: Assassin
intro.line: No questions! Prepare yourself!!!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hey!

intro.speaker: Assassin
intro.line: Aaaargg! Aaaaah!!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What? An arrow?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Who are–

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Milady Lyndis!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I’m fine. He... This man saved me.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: May I ask your name?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Wait! Why did you help me?

intro.speaker: Rider
intro.line: I thought a Sacaean plainswoman was being attacked. I was mistaken.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: No, you were right! I am from Sacae. I’m Lyn, the daughter of the Lorca chieftain.

intro.speaker: Rider
intro.line: The Lorca? There were survivors?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Rider
intro.line: You should leave at once. A blaze has started in the castle, and it’s spreading. Don’t be foolish and waste the life I just saved.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You’re from the castle? What’s happening? How severe is the fire? Is the marquess safe?

intro.speaker: Rider
intro.line: The castle is under attack, and the marquess has been accosted. The man who attacked you was probably one of the marauders. As captain of the castle guard, it’s my duty to rescue the marquess.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I see... All right then, we’ll help you.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Milady?

intro.speaker: Rider
intro.line: Why?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: These brigands are after me. If they’re attacking the castle, it’s because of me. So I must help if I can...

intro.speaker: Rider
intro.line: It sounds like you’re involved somehow... Let’s go.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You’ll accept our aid?

intro.speaker: Rath
intro.line: I am Rath of the Kutolah. Our tribes may be different, but I will not abandon a woman of the Sacae.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Thank you, Rath! A thousand blessings upon you!

intro.speaker: Rath
intro.line: And a thousand curses upon our enemy!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Come!

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: You! What are you doing in my house?!

intro.speaker: Thief
intro.line: Peace! I mean no danger to you! Your home offers a good view of the battle outside. Look, I’ll pay you for the privilege. Please.

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: Like a vulture waiting for the spoils, eh? Terrible! Pay up! I’ll be hiding below, so don’t bother me.

intro.speaker: Thief
intro.line: I wouldn’t dream of it.

intro.speaker: Thief
intro.line: Now then, which side has the most to offer?

intro.speaker: Rath
intro.line: Once the marquess is safe, my men can move in. Perhaps the secret passageway...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Secret passageway?

intro.speaker: Rath
intro.line: An underground tunnel leading to the throne room. There are triggers in the barracks that will open the tunnel.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Head through the passage to the throne room... and rescue the marquess. Once that’s done, can you drive the enemy from the castle?

intro.speaker: Rath
intro.line: Mmm... If we can release those triggers, my men and I can handle the rest. There are three triggers, though. All three need to be released, or the entrance won’t open.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: But the doors to the barracks are locked.

intro.speaker: Rath
intro.line: The enemy’s within. If we don’t get inside and finish them, we’re stuck.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: So opening those doors is our first objective.

intro.speaker: Tutorial
intro.line: The goal of this chapter is to open the doors and reach the 3 triggers located inside. To open doors, you need door keys or the services of a thief.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: So this is the final one. We should be good to go.

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: The last trigger. This should do it.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: This must be the last trigger. That should do it.

battle.speaker: Florina
battle.line: Hey... This just might be the last trigger. So, I only need to...

battle.speaker: Wil
battle.line: Aha! Found it! The last trigger... Well, here goes...

battle.speaker: Dorcas
battle.line: The final trigger. If I just press this...

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: Eww. Is this the last trigger? Guess I’ll try moving it around.

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: This must be the last trigger. That should do it, then.

battle.speaker: Rath
battle.line: This is it. The last trigger. If I press this...

battle.speaker: Matthew
battle.line: OK. This is the last one. This should do the trick.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Here it is, Mark! The hidden passageway! Good work! We’ll let Rath take over from here.

recruit-visit.speaker: Thief
recruit-visit.line: Hey, you! Can I talk to you?

recruit-visit.speaker: Matthew
recruit-visit.line: I’m Matthew, a specialist in acquisitions of all kinds. Would you like to buy my services?

recruit-visit.speaker: Lyn
recruit-visit.line: I’ve no need for a thief.

recruit-visit.speaker: Matthew
recruit-visit.line: Really? And how do you plan on opening the barrack doors?

recruit-visit.speaker: Lyn
recruit-visit.line: What? How did you know about–

recruit-visit.speaker: Matthew
recruit-visit.line: Don’t be mad. Hire me. For you, I’ll even lower my normal rate.

recruit-visit.speaker: Lyn
recruit-visit.line: I do need those doors opened... OK. You’re hired. Why did you choose to ally yourself with me?

recruit-visit.speaker: Matthew
recruit-visit.line: Hm? I was watching the battle from up above. Your group looked like a lot more fun than the dead guy. Pretty simple, really.

recruit-visit.speaker: Matthew
recruit-visit.line: It’s time to get to work!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: We can’t do business with all the fighting in town. You’re mercenaries, right? Can’t you do something? Huh? You can’t get the barracks open? I bet a thief with a set of picks could open any door you needed. Hold on. I may have something here to help you... Here it is! This is it. One door key. Door keys can only be used once, but anyone can use them. Here! No charge. Now go get those thugs, will you.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: So what’s your weapon of choice? Swords, lances, spears? Or do you favor bows or magic? Staves? Whatever it may be, the more you use it, the more skilled you become. Swinging your sword about will allow you to master it. Eventually, you’ll be able to wield weapons of greater power. It’s as they say: Practice makes perfect. You can check your skill level by pressing the R Button.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: The captain of the marquess’s guard is a fellow named Rath... I’ve heard tell that he’s a nomad from the plains of Sacae. Odd, considering how the marquess so obviously hates the nomads. I guess the marquess is pleased to have a nomad under his control. The ways of aristocrats are beyond my comprehension.

visit.speaker: Lady
visit.line: The marquess of Araphen’s hatred for the people of Sacae is well known. Nomads are barred entrance to the city on the marquess’s orders. He says he will not allow the nomads’ stench to infect his city. Long ago, the marquess was in love with Marquess Caelin’s daughter. It’s said she spurned him in favor of a nomadic prince. Even so, I think the marquess goes too far in his treatment of the horsemen.

battle-talk.speaker: Serra
battle-talk.line: I feel something... I feel it!!! Someone’s staring at me! It must be some poor fool who’s smitten with me. Alas, my beauty has rendered him speechless. Ah... I’m so cute it’s almost criminal.

battle-talk.speaker: Matthew
battle-talk.line: What in the world is that woman doing here? I cannot let HER find the passageway...

boss.speaker: Bool
boss.line: Bah. Lyndis and her cadre. When did you arrive? No matter. I shall deal with you.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Ah, it’s Rath! You’ve done well. What a performance!

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: Sir... If you have praise, it should be given to this group.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Hm? Who are you?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: My name is Lyndis. I’m pleased you’re well.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Oh... It’s you. You’re Marquess Caelin’s– Leave us, Rath. I would speak with this girl.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Now... Lady Lyndis. Do you know the identity of those responsible for this uproar?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I believe it to be the work of my granduncle, Lundgren.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: That’s exactly right. Which means my castle has been damaged in your family’s petty inheritance dispute.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: My-My apologies...

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: When I heard that Lady Madelyn’s daughter was in trouble, I thought to lend my assistance... I find I’ve changed my mind. I withdraw my offer.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Marquess Araphen! You gave me your word, my lord!

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: ... Your name is Kent, is it not? You failed to inform me of one most vital detail!

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: What... What do you mean?

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: This girl does resemble Lady Madelyn, but... I didn’t expect to see her so tainted with the blood of Sacae.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What?!?

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Don’t you feel the marquess of Caelin would be troubled to meet this... nomadic mongrel?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: You–!

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Sain! Hold! My apologies, my lord Marquess.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Hm... Your man is poorly disciplined.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Marquess Araphen! Please... If you would grace us with your aid...

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: ...... I hear Marquess Caelin is ill and abed. I question whether he will survive to meet this girl. In which case, his brother, Lundgren, will claim his title. And I certainly wish to avoid trouble with the coming marquess.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: You scheming...

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Sain!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I understand. Kent, Sain, we take our leave at once.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Milady Lyndis! We–

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I am proud of the Sacae blood that runs through my veins. I will NOT accept aid from one who disparages my heritage.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: That was well done, milady! The marquess is a lout! Don’t worry about anything. We’re all here for you! Isn’t that so, Kent?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: I beg your forgiveness.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Why are you apologizing, Kent?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: I’ve been so concerned with seeing you to Caelin. I failed to take your feelings into account.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Is that it? Trouble yourself no more. You have put my safety above all else. I have seen that. Hold your head up and be proud.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Milady Lyndis...

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Bah! Arrogant child! If she had but shed a single tear, I would have granted her request. We Lycian nobles will never understand those prideful savages.

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: ...... Are those your true feelings toward the nomads of Sacae, milord?

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: What? Oh, Rath! I didn’t see you there. My comments do not reflect on you. You are my captain. I’m proud of your service.

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: Of course. As long as we bend our knee to you, you care not where we’re from. But when an equal comes from my lands? What conceit.

end.speaker: Marquess Araphen
end.line: Rath! How can you speak to me like that? I have treated you well, have I not? I have paid you well. I have treated you better than your kind deserves.

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: You will never understand. My service ends here.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: The marquess of Araphen... He said my grandfather was ill. We must hurry to Caelin...

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: As we approach Caelin, Lundgren’s obstacles will be more difficult to overcome. However, I’ve vowed to see you through to the end, milady!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I’m counting on you, Kent.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: I’m with you, too!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Thank you, Sain.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Mark... Thank you for always standing at my side. It’s because of all of you that I... I will persevere! They will never break my spirit!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Rath! What is it? What are you–

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: I overheard the marquess talking to himself. Lyn of the Lorca... Proud daughter of the Sacae... I would join you. I would add my strength to yours.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Really?

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: And this... I want you to take it.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: This is... Gold!? It’s too much. I can’t accept it.

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: I have no need for it. And if it will help you...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Rath
end.line: I cannot take back something once offered.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Rath... I thank you.
